comment: This professor is IMPOSSIBLE to reach. And if you think this won't affect your grade you're wrong. Her quiz answers when submitted are wrong. She gives you two try's but don't trust the ones mark wrong 90% of the time they're right and getting her to go back an correct it is again IMPOSSIBLE. she's a horrible Prof. Idk why ksu hasn't fired her.

Never responded to my emails when I asked for her help on the discussion posts. Hardest grader on the posts. She is very specific on what she wants but does not make them clear to you. Didn't grade everything until the day before grades were due. Also, if you miss 3 assignments out of 20+ and you gave a B as your final grade she will put a C.

This professor never answers emails and she grades too hard on her research papers. She is also ridiculous on her grades for discussions.  She has a very rigid grading rubric.  Some of the online tests had answers marked wrong, when they were actually right, so this obviously affects your grade.

Took the online class & students are constantly sending emails asking if anyone has heard from our prof. She goes MIA, takes weeks to grade, doesn't respond to emails, & majority of her due dates on the syllabus are completely off from the dropbox dates. Absolutely zero clarity in this class. Fortunately, quizzes are simple & easy.

If you like organization don't take this professor. Her syllabus says one thing & D2L dropbox says another. She takes FOREVER to grade anything & she expects WAY too much for the discussions. 250+ words for your original post, plus two 250+ word responses, so unnecessary. She'll respond to emails (with an attitude) and lie about grading assignments

She is great.  Her instructions are to email her at her work email address to get a quick response because D2L sometimes has tech issues.  Or if the answer is in the syllabus she told us she expects that we have read the information.  It isn't her fault if students blame the instructor instead of doing their responsibilities.

You must purchase the book, if not you will NOT pass the class! The book is needed for test, discussions, and written assignments ( & it doesn't cost much)! Easy class if you do better online than in class! But beware: she isn't quick with updating grades in D2L & doesn't respond fairly quick to emails.

The syllabus is all over the place & the class seems unorganized.  Makes you sign a contract prior to writing papers, takes forever to grade anything, the discussions are lengthy & have multiple requirements in order to get a good grade (post replies on another day, include a source, etc.) and she doesn't come across as overly friendly or helpful.
She is awesome, just do your work and you will be just fine.

Pretty straightforward class. 4 quizzes. Participation in discussions is a must. Two papers - must complete contract for both or you get a 0 for the entire paper. The problem with her is that she is basically unreachable, and for an online class, that is inexcusable. She had a legit reason this semester, but she left us hanging for a good 2 weeks.

Excellent instructor who has everything clearly outlined if you read the introduction folder.  Two attempts at exams are given and we had writing samples and templates to follow.  I was told by a previous student that she expects senior level work to be submitted because it is a senior level course. I learned a lot, and was challenged.

Hm her online class is okay. She is kind of horrible at responding like you can feel her ignoring your emails. I have no idea how she grades because she gave me a low grade on something I actually put my time and effort on.But the workload isn't much. I don't really know how to describe this class. It wasn't all that bad, but not that great either.

She is HORRIBLE at responding to emails. I know multiple students who never got respones back to her even though her syllabus says she responds within 24 hours. My friend had to  drop her class because the professor never sent a response to her email.

Professor Keita is well organized and crystal clear with her expectations. This is my second and unfortunately last course with her but I would recommend her to anyone. Because its online there is a self-learning/teaching component but she facilitates excellent discussions and paper topics. If you're a sociology or CJ major, take her!

Professor is def. passionate about sociology and she teaches her class this way. I took this class online and it is definitely an easy A. Weekly internet activities, weekly discussion posts, 2 quizzes, midterm and a final. You get 2 tries for all of them. Do the work and you'll get an A.

I took this course online. Dr. Keita is very clear about her expectations for discussion posts. She breaks her course up into 4 quarters. There are weekly posts, 2 quizzes, midterm and a final. You will use the book for this course. My only complaint is her timeliness with responses and the amount of interaction You may not her from her for a week.

Enjoyed the class- enthusiastic about her students doing well but does not play around.  She expects papers to be of professional quality, so to do well have to follow outline given.  Textbook is challenging but learned more than I expected.

This class was fun. I learned a lot more than I expected to learn.  The instructor was always helpful and worked with me when I struggled with the research assignment.  I would take a class with her again.

Took this as an online course.  The worse mistake I could have done.  The teacher does NOT respond back to emails in a timely fashion.  She actually FORCED me to take a C when I could have recieved an A or B.  Took issue to Dept Chair, and never was able to get my situation rectified.  I feel completely let down by administration and my teacher.

Highly recommend this as an online class. Easy to manage even if you have a full schedule of classes. Keep a reg schedule of when to post and read the book = A. Tests are more than fair with 2 attempts on each of them.
LOVE this instructor!  I would not say an easy A but her discussions really make you think.  She is very excited about sociology...almost too excited, but it makes for an interesting class.

Easy A, but a total waste of money if you have any interest in learning. It was online, so no actual instruction given. Buying the book was a waste of money, as her power points covered all the important info. She was very slow to put up grades for online writings and other graded assignments, but did give 2 chances on quizzes, so 100% is easy.

Easy class but intense. To get an "A" you have to be present every assignment and do well on the papers and presentation.  She was willing to look at my paper before I submitted it so I knew what she was looking for.  She was nice and seemed she wanted the class to do a good job.

Awful professor!My first time receiving a (C) in a Sociology course. Her grading is very harsh when it comes to discussions and papers. All quizzes,exams and midterms are open book.Thats about the only good thing in this class. The powerpoint she gives is not helpful, its misleading.Try taking another professor if you want an A ;)
Her class was very interesting and she is very intelligent.   I like her style of teaching and way of getting students involved. I would take her again.

Great Class! Discussion  and internet activity are simple ! just answer the question and great detail and you will do fine.Two quizzes and 1 midterm and a final you have two opportunities to take them. Don't buy a book use google and her power points ;) EASYYYYYYYYYY;)

I have NO idea why people are recommending her. I had her for an online course and she was TERRIBLE! I ended up getting an A in the course BUT the work load I had to put in for a 2000 level elective was RIDICULOUS! Her grading is beyond extreme. You'll be spending a TON of time on this course if you take her and want to make an A.

Took her class online. To get an A in her class you only have to read a chapter per week and post 2-3 discussions related to that chapter and do one internet activity per week on time.  Quizzes and exams are easy and you get 2 attempts each. Easiest class this semester!

Wonderful class! two attempts to take the quizzes and test both are time , but should not be a problem since you can view your first attempt before taking the second test. Do not buy a book waste of money! she post power points on Vista. Also, have discussions that are due every week & an internet assignment Easy A ! ;)

I've had this professor for two classes and she has  given me great feedback. From my experience, if one does not do what is expected of them or realize that online classes take more work than regular classes, you will not do well in any of her courses and most likely will not like her teaching style.  I thought she is truly insightful.

Absolutely terrible instructor. She likes to pretend she is organized and clear but she is not. I am taking this class online and it has been such a nightmare. So much work and pointless assignments are necessary. She has bizarre rules regarding when and how frequently you can post- RIDICULOUS. I AM NOT SURE HOW/WHY SHE IS RECOMMENDED ON HERE.
Loved the prof!
Teacher was not completely clear on writing assignments. I usually get A's on most of my papers in other classes but she always gave me C's. I passed but not without being irritated in the end.

This class was hard!!!  It was extremely interesting and loved the course, however, you have to keep on top of the weekly emails sent by the instructor or you will miss a lot of information that could cost you a grade.  A lot of work but a fun instructor!

I enjoyed this prof.teaching style and her passion for students to learn the subject.  I've taken 2 of her courses and they are a lot of work- but you learn a lot in her courses.  She knows her stuff!
Great professor! I took her class online and she allowed 2 attempts for each of the quizzes, midterm, and final. I definitely recommend her!
I love her class all discussion 2 papers I got an A. Its an EASY A!
